p: Resveratrol (Res), a natural polyphenol derived from plants, such as Polygonum cuspidatum, grape, peanut and mulberry[ 1– 4], has a wide range of pharmacological activities, including anticancer, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory and antineuralgic[ 5– 9], thus, it has attracted the attention of researchers. However, Res is a class II drug in the Biopharmaceutics Classification System (BCS) with poor water solubility (0.03 mg/mL) and high permeability.[ 10– 12] Accordingly, improving the solubility of Res is a top priority.
